title: Interpretable Neural Architectures
author: Dr. Aisha Khan, Prof. Tomás Varela, Mei Lin
description: This paper proposes a modular transformer model optimized for low-resource language pairs, improving translation quality while maintaining interpretability through attention heatmaps.

title: Biochar Applications in Agroecosystems
author: Priya Deshmukh, Dr. Nathaniel Moore, Isabel Rocha
description: A systematic review and meta-analysis of biochar use across 42 crop systems globally, analyzing its effects on yield, soil health, and carbon sequestration.

title: Digital Burnouts
author: Dr. Ananya Singh, Matteo Ricci, Hannah Feld
description: Using EEG and self-reported stress scores, this study examines the cognitive fatigue caused by persistent notification exposure in knowledge workers.

title: Targeting Mitochondrial Dysfunction
author: Dr. Kevin Okafor, Alice Bianchi, Min-Jae Park
description: Uncover hidden patterns and let the numbers tell their stories.

title: The Sociolinguistics of AI-Generated Text
author: Luis Fernandez, Dr. Rebecca Chong, Simona Volkov
description: An analysis of dialect drift in large language models trained on multilingual corpora, and its implications for cross-cultural communication.

title: Decentralized Federated Learning for Healthcare
author: Dr. Rohan Patel, Emily Johansson, Farah Al-Tamimi
description: Presents a secure, decentralized approach to federated learning in hospital networks, preserving patient privacy while enhancing predictive accuracy.

title: Resilient Urban Infrastructure under Climate Stress
author: Dr. Naomi Adegoke, Chen Liu, Marco Santoro
description: Using simulation-based modeling, this study evaluates urban infrastructure resilience across five megacities facing extreme weather patterns.

title: The Future of Remote Work in Emerging Economies
author: Anjali Krishnan, Dr. Tadeusz Nowak, Jamal Okeke
description: Sociotechnical analysis of remote work adoption in rural regions, with focus on infrastructure gaps, productivity metrics, and digital equity.

title: Metabolic Modeling of Gut Microbiota
author: Dr. Lucia Romano, Haruto Yamazaki, Nia K. Davis
description: Presents a dynamic model of short-chain fatty acid production in response to dietary shifts, simulating over 200 bacterial interactions.

title: Neuromorphic Chips for Edge Robotics
author: Dr. Felix Anders, Zahra Elhassan, Miguel Barreto
description: Explores energy-efficient processing in swarm robotics using silicon-based neuromorphic chips that mimic brain signal patterns.

title: Low-Carbon Cement from Industrial Waste
author: Dr. Hanna Becker, Ahmed El-Masry, Tenzin Norbu
description: This work introduces a novel cement formulation utilizing steel slag and fly ash, achieving 60% carbon footprint reduction compared to OPC.

title: Acoustic Monitoring of Pollinator Populations
author: Dr. Jonas Eriksson, Alice M. Wong, Thando Khumalo
description: Uses acoustic signatures and deep learning to monitor bee and insect activity across 12 agricultural zones during peak flowering seasons.

title: Reconstructing Ancient Trade Routes with Network Theory
author: Elena Grigoriev, Dr. Omar Bashir, Matteo Romano
description: Applies graph theory to archaeological data to uncover probable trade corridors across the Mediterranean during the Bronze Age.

title: Photonic Crystals for Optical Neural Networks
author: Dr. Grace Kamau, Viktor Novák, Diana Liu
description: Proposes a scalable optical neural computing architecture using tunable photonic crystal arrays to perform matrix multiplication tasks.

title: Behavioral Economics in Pandemic Policy Compliance
author: Dr. Nadia Bellucci, Faisal Rahman, Yuki Nakamura
description: A cross-national survey and simulation of behavioral incentives used to increase public compliance with emergency health measures.

title: Autonomous Farming Systems in Arid Regions
author: Mohammed Idris, Dr. Clara Neves, Seung-Ho Park
description: Demonstrates sensor-driven autonomous irrigation and drone planting methods to optimize crop yield in desertified farmland.

title: Emotion Recognition from Multimodal Biometric Inputs
author: Dr. Marta Silva, Henry Ofori, Jin-Soo Han
description: Combines facial micro-expression analysis with galvanic skin response and vocal tone to improve real-time emotion classification.

title: Smart Grids and Decentralized Energy Governance
author: Dr. Viktoria Petrov, Samuel Achebe, Reema Kapoor
description: Explores governance models for smart microgrids using local energy markets and peer-to-peer trading in semi-urban communities.
